edu.first.util

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.util.Properties

  • public final class Properties
extends java.lang.Object
    The class representation of files on the cRIO that contain "properties". This means that there are different values that are accessible by a key. Property files contain the values separated by lines, with an equals sign to indicate what the value is. Ex. 
     Key = Example Value
 ShooterSpeed = 42
 ShooterSpeedFar = 60
 EncoderDistance = 12.32
    Properties are stored as strings only, and cannot be verified as doubles/ints/longs/etc. That has to be done in client code.
    Since:
    May 13 13

    • Constructor Detail

      • Properties

        public Properties(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the object that will read the properties file. No processing or I/O is done inside of the constructor, so construction is not resource heavy. For all intents and purposes, fileName should be the same as the argument in TextFiles.getTextFromFile(java.lang.String). That definition is subject to change outside of this class' control.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file with properties in it

    • Method Detail

      • getFileContents

        public java.lang.String getFileContents()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the string with the file's entire contents. Does no parse it into properties.
        Returns:
        the contents of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when reading from the file throws an exception

      • getProperties

        public Properties.Property[] getProperties()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an array of properties which are suitable for using. Specifications of property files that are needed for this method to return valid results:
        • All properties are separated by new lines (Windows / Unix Line Endings)
        • All keys are separated by their values using an equals sign
        • No other equals signs are present
        Spaces around the key and value (ex. key = value) are are disregarded.
        Returns:
        all properties in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when reading from the file throws an exception

      • getProperty

        public Properties.Property getProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the property object that has the specific key. Returns null if no property under the name exists.
        Parameters:
        key - string used to declare the property
        Returns:
        Property object corresponding to key

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the actual value designated in the file under the key.
        Parameters:
        key - string used to declare the property
        Returns:
        value given to the key in the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when key does not exist

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String backup)
        Returns the actual value designated in the file under the key.
        Parameters:
        key - string used to declare the property
        backup - value used if it did not exist in the file
        Returns:
        value given to the key in the file
